net.java.dev.designgridlayout
Interface IRow

All Known Subinterfaces:
IGridRow, INonGridRow, ISpannableGridRow
public interface IRow

Any row created by DesignGridLayout implements this minimal interface. Through this interface you can add components to the row.

Subsequent calls to methods that add components result in adding components left to right, i.e. the last added component is positioned to the right of the previously last added component.

Note that DesignGridLayout methods will return more specific interfaces (that extend IRow).

Author:
Jean-Francois Poilpret

Method Summary
 IRow add(JComponent... children)
          Adds components to this row; each component has its own "column" in the row.
 IRow addMulti(JComponent... children)
          Adds components to this row; all components are "assembled" as one global component and use only one "column" in the row.
 

Method Detail

add

IRow add(JComponent... children)
Adds components to this row; each component has its own "column" in the row. Components are added left to right, in the same order as they appear in the arguments list.

Parameters:
children - components to add to this row
Returns:
this row (to allow chaining other methods for the current row)

addMulti

IRow addMulti(JComponent... children)
Adds components to this row; all components are "assembled" as one global component and use only one "column" in the row.

Note that the width of each individual component will never grow bigger than its preferred width.

Parameters:
children - components to assemble and add to this row
Returns:
this row (to allow chaining other methods for the current row)
